zone.line: themselves desire; the evil punished
as all things evil ought to be pu-
nished, not by pain which is revol-
ting to all philanthropy to consider
but by quiet obscurity, which simply
deprives them of their harmful
qualities; Why kill the serpent when
you have extracted his fangs?
The poetry of his language and
ideas which my words ill convey held
me enchained to his discourses. It
was a melancholy pleasure to me
to listen to his inspired words; to
catch for a for moment the light
of his eyes to feel sympathy a tran
-sient sympathy and then to awaken
from the delusion, again to know
that all this was nothing, – a dream –
a shadow for that there was no reallity
for me; my father had for ever
deserted me, leaving me only memories
